name: Korean Spicy Marinated Pork (Dae Ji Bool Gogi)
author: funinthesun
summary: This spicy Korean pork is very good served with rice, kimchi, and salad.
ingredients: ½ cup gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste)
3  green onions, cut into 2 inch pieces
½  yellow onion, cut into 1/4-inch thick rings
1 (2 pound) pork loin, cut into 1/4 inch slices
directions: Stir together the vinegar, soy sauce, hot pepper paste, garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, black pepper, sugar, green onions, and yellow onion in a large bowl
Mix in the pork slices, mixing well until completely coated
Place into a resealable plastic bag, squeeze out any excess air, seal, and marinate in the refrigerator at least 3 hours
Heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add the pork slices in batches, and cook until no longer pink in the center, and lightly browned on the outside, about 5 minutes per batch
